greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of labeled spanning intersecting set-systems on n vertices with no singletons.
comment: An intersecting set-system S is a finite set of finite nonempty sets (edges), any two of which have a nonempty intersection. S is spanning if every vertex is contained in some edge. A singleton is an edge containing only one vertex.
formula: Inverse binomial transform of A306000. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 12 2019
example: The a(3) = 12 spanning intersecting set-systems with no singletons:
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Jun 15 2018
